page.title: 04TONMAWR - 1981 CENSUS
page.content: An inspection of the results of the {1981 National Census}as applied to the Tonmawr area was made with special regard to the kinds and degrees of deprivation experienced by people living in its communities. Generally Tonmawr people were found to have housing of average standard - little overcrowding or missing 'standard' amenities. (e.g. bathrooms, inside toilets.) but they suffered from unemployment to a greater extent than the average for the County, especially younger age groups. The community had fewer cars than average, despite being relatively isolated.(5 miles from Neath).Yet there are few amenities in the valley. There was a marked lack of people in managerial / supervisory roles compared with County average. An above average number of families had 3 generations in the same household.
